actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Mr. Duncan moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 482.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 109-312.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 555.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Pombo asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.

references.type: text as House agreed to Senate amendment

actions.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 109-474.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health
Subcommittee on Public Lands and Forests

official_title: To provide for a land exchange involving Federal lands in the Lincoln National Forest in the State of New Mexico, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Pine Springs Land Exchange Act - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to convey to Lubbock Christian University by quitclaim deed all right of the United States to specified federal land in the Lincoln National Forest in New Mexico in exchange for the conveyance of certain University land (the non-federal land). Requires that: (1) title to the non-federal land conform with the title approval standards of the Attorney General applicable to federal land acquisitions and be otherwise acceptable to the Secretary; and (2) the costs of implementing the exchange be shared equally by the Secretary and the University. Sets forth provisions regarding: (1) the correction of minor errors in the map; (2) revocation and withdrawal of federal land; and (3) administration of land acquired by the United States. Instructs the Secretary, in exercising any discretion necessary to carry out this Act, to ensure that the public interest is well served.

titles.title: To provide for a land exchange involving Federal lands in the Lincoln National Forest in the State of New Mexico, and for other purposes.
